rs.

ke that with us. "

rying an offering of fish, kneels down before Tucson and Talon. Tucson look=
s to the offering. It was a most generous portion of fish. Yet now he could=

e Protohuman and accepts his offering with a gentile touch of his nose on t=
he man's shoulder. He allows him to stroke his snout as some sort of good l=
uck ritual.  The man bows in graciousness to Tucson's gesture of kindness a=
nd leaves him be with Talon.

t. I wonder if these people had any interaction with the old Silver Dragon.=
. "

> > > > > It isn't long before others come to offer more gi=
fts to him and Talon. One of the Protohumans points to a painting on a rock=

h outstretched wings.
> > > > >

e him, he would return their kind gestures by offering his protection. But =
there is more to these paintings.. A strange mysterious figure, with an aur=
a around it.. To me it seems evil. Another idol, someone else to worship. .=
. People portrayed in black and white.. White, meaning those who look to th=
e Silver Dragon and black to those who worship the intimidating idol.. I've=
 seen ancient pictographs before on Cybertron, and these are different but =
in the same format. Talon if the dragon is a physical being, then this dark=
 idol must be as well. We need to find it, before it lays harm to anyone."

miration rather than hostility. Tucson looks to them curiously.
> > > > > >=
 >

ut it appears as if they're here to admire rather than attack. I wonder... =
"
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > He stands up and gets back into beast mode, =
and sits down once more. The creatures draw closer to him and sit beside hi=
m and Talon. It was clear that the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to=
 these creatures, but that was about to change once he and Talon left for C=
ybertron. It was a massive guilt slammed upon his heart. Yet how could he g=
et the animals to understand that he had to leave them in such a short time=
? He was now their guardian and they were looking up to him for protection.=
 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > " Talon, these creatures remember the old dr=
agon that sought to their protection and realize that I have taken his plac=
e. It's as I thought, they aren't aware of who we really are, and where we =
are from. They will not understand that we must leave them shortly, for goo=
d, and Primus knows what will happen to them once we leave. ... Talon, I he=
ar something coming. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large creature."=

> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots the scales of=
 a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream next to t=
hem. He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts its head=
. It was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he was, but th=
e same coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was female. She l=
ooks to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and they look gen=
tly to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalization, Tucson=
 explains who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and bows her h=
ead. She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating as Tucson looks=
 back to Talon.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > " Apparently the old dragon ha=
s family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she said that she wil=
l protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as long=
 as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
> > > > > > > 
=
> > > > > > > With that, the dragoness leaves them peacefully to enjoy thei=
r time together. With a gentile groan, the creatures too, depart. It was tr=
uly a spiritual moment for both of them.

same time. Then, I met you and things began to change on a more positive no=
te. You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my path, and you sa=
w me on the right road and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards, I be=
came a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimu=
s Prime, yet different. But one thing didn't change, I was still battling b=

evious form, which could not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolutio=
n, this one. All of these things wouldn't have come about if I had never me=
t you. And I wouldn't have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this planet=

 planet and it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."
